channel.title: Explore Dremio Home Screen on Dremio Modernization Workshop
channel.description: Recent content in Explore Dremio Home Screen on Dremio Modernization Workshop

item.title: Explore Dremio Home Screen
item.description: Explore Dremio Home Screen The Dremio Home screen has 4 major areas: Home Space The Home Space is a private user work area that can contain both physical and virtual datasets. Uploaded files promoted to a physical dataset are stored in the home space. Data can be curated in the home space until its ready to be shared by moving it to a shared space. Spaces Spaces are shared locations for saving virtual datasets.

item.title: Creating a folder in your personal space
item.description: Creating a folder in your personal space From the Dremio home screen, click the folder icon at the top right of the Home Space. Provide a name to the folder and click Save Note: You can use this folder to save any Physical Datasets (PDS) or Virtual Datasets (VDS) that you create during this workshop.

item.title: Set up a Space to collaborate with other users
item.description: Set up a Space to collaborate with other users From the Dremio home screen click the "+" icon next to “Spaces” . Provide a name for your Space and click Save

item.title: Explore the different data connections that Dremio supports
item.description: Explore the different data connections that Dremio supports Under “Data Lakes” in the bottom left corner of the Dremio home screen, click "+" icon. You will see a list of the various Table Stores & File Stores that Dremio natively supports. We will be using this to create a connection to an AWS S3 data source in a later step. Under “External Sources” in the bottom left corner of the Dremio home screen click "
